elementTypes.name: Business Actor
elementTypes.documentation: A business entity that is capable of performing behavior.

elementTypes.name: Business Role
elementTypes.documentation: The responsibility for performing specific behavior, to which an actor can be assigned.

elementTypes.name: Business Process
elementTypes.documentation: A sequence of business behaviors that achieves a specific result.

elementTypes.name: Business Function
elementTypes.documentation: A collection of business behavior based on a chosen set of criteria.

elementTypes.name: Business Event
elementTypes.documentation: An organizational state change.

elementTypes.name: Business Service
elementTypes.documentation: An explicitly defined exposed business behavior.

elementTypes.name: Business Object
elementTypes.documentation: A concept used within a particular business domain.

elementTypes.name: Application Component
elementTypes.documentation: An encapsulation of application functionality aligned to implementation structure.

elementTypes.name: Application Interface
elementTypes.documentation: A point of access where application services are made available to a user, another application component, or a node.

elementTypes.name: Application Service
elementTypes.documentation: An explicitly defined exposed application behavior.

elementTypes.name: Data Object
elementTypes.documentation: Data structured for automated processing.

elementTypes.name: Node
elementTypes.documentation: A computational or physical resource that hosts, manipulates, or interacts with other computational or physical resources.

elementTypes.name: Device
elementTypes.documentation: A physical IT resource upon which system software and artifacts may be stored or deployed for execution.

elementTypes.name: System Software
elementTypes.documentation: Software that provides or contributes to an environment for storing, executing, and using software or data.

elementTypes.name: Technology Interface
elementTypes.documentation: A point of access where technology services offered by a node can be accessed.

elementTypes.name: Communication Network
elementTypes.documentation: A set of structures that connects nodes for transmission, routing, and reception of data.

elementTypes.name: Technology Service
elementTypes.documentation: An explicitly defined exposed technology behavior.

elementTypes.name: Artifact
elementTypes.documentation: A piece of data that is used or produced in a software development process, or by deployment and operation of an IT system.

elementTypes.name: Grouping
elementTypes.documentation: Aggregates or composes concepts that belong together based on some common characteristic.

elementTypes.name: Location
elementTypes.documentation: A place or position where structure elements can be located or behavior can be performed.

relationshipTypes.name: Composition
relationshipTypes.documentation: Indicates that an element consists of one or more other concepts.

relationshipTypes.name: Aggregation
relationshipTypes.documentation: Indicates that an element combines one or more other concepts.

relationshipTypes.name: Assignment
relationshipTypes.documentation: Links active elements with units of behavior that are performed by them, or roles that are fulfilled by them.

relationshipTypes.name: Realization
relationshipTypes.documentation: Indicates that an entity plays a critical role in the creation, achievement, sustenance, or operation of a more abstract entity.

relationshipTypes.name: Serving
relationshipTypes.documentation: Models that an element provides its functionality to another element.

relationshipTypes.name: Access
relationshipTypes.documentation: Models the access of behavioral elements to business or data objects.

relationshipTypes.name: Triggering
relationshipTypes.documentation: Represents a temporal or causal relationship between elements.

relationshipTypes.name: Flow
relationshipTypes.documentation: Represents transfer from one element to another.

relationshipTypes.name: Specialization
relationshipTypes.documentation: Indicates that an element is a particular kind of another element.

relationshipTypes.name: Association
relationshipTypes.documentation: Models an unspecified relationship, or a relationship that is not represented by another ArchiMate relationship.

viewpoints.name: Layered
viewpoints.description: Provides an overview across multiple layers and aspects of an enterprise architecture.

viewpoints.name: Organization
viewpoints.description: Shows the structure of the enterprise in terms of roles and actors.

viewpoints.name: Business Process Cooperation
viewpoints.description: Shows the relationships between business processes.

viewpoints.name: Application Cooperation
viewpoints.description: Shows application components and their interrelationships.

viewpoints.name: Application Usage
viewpoints.description: Shows how applications are used to support business processes.

viewpoints.name: Technology Usage
viewpoints.description: Shows how technology supports the application layer.
